content: The GeForce 30 series is a family of graphics processing units developed by Nvidia, succeeding the GeForce 20 series. The series was announced on September 1, 2020, and started shipping on September 17, 2020. The cards are based on the Ampere architecture and feature hardware-accelerated raytracing (RTX) with Nvidia's second-generation RT cores and third-generation Tensor Cores.The launch of the 30 series was panned for its lack of availability, and critics attributed it to high demand during the COVID-19 pandemic and some consumers using bots to buy large numbers of cards for resale.
